channel.title: automotive-security on DH.J
channel.description: Recent content in automotive-security on DH.J

item.title: Car Hacking Village DC31
item.description: Summary I attended the Car Hacking Village CTF at the DEFCON hacking conference in Las Vegas on the 10th. I participated as a member of Autocrypt with a total of 13 people and we finished in 4th place at the end of the competition. We would like to thank @uberwoozle for organizing this competition. [사진 1] CHV31 Scoreboard Write up TBD, The challenge will be made public once the solution is finalized.

item.title: GM Equinox Automotive Infotainment Vulnerability
item.description: Information Vehicle model : GM Chevrolet Equinox 2021 Software version : 2021.03.26 build ver. CVE Assignment : CVE-2023-39076 Summary We analyzed the vulnerabilities in the infotainment system of General Motors (GM) Chevrolet Equinox 2021 vehicle and found a USB memory vulnerability that caused the infotainment to crash. Analysis TBD (No plans to go public yet.) Impact This attack could allow an attacker to abnormally shut down the vehicle’s infotainment system (resulting in an internal crash).

item.title: Renault ZOE Automotive Infotainment Vulnerability
item.description: Information Vehicle model : Renault ZOE EV 2021 Software version : 283C35202R CVE Assignment : CVE-2023-39075 Summary We analyzed the vulnerabilities in the infotainment system of Renault’s ZOE EV vehicle and found a USB memory vulnerability that caused the infotainment to crash. [Figure 1]] Vendor Reply E-mail Analysis TBD (No plans to go public yet.) Impact This attack could allow an attacker to abnormally shut down the vehicle’s infotainment system (resulting in an internal crash).

item.title: Volkswagen Jetta Automotive Infotainment Vulnerability
item.description: Information Vehicle model : Volkswagen Jetta 2021 Hardware version : 724 Software version : 0876 Summary We analyzed the vulnerabilities in the infotainment system of Volkswagen Jetta vehicle and found a USB memory vulnerability that caused the infotainment to crash. Analysis TBD (No plans to go public yet.) Impact This attack could allow an attacker to abnormally shut down the vehicle’s infotainment system (resulting in an internal crash). DEMO Copyright Donghyeon Jeong / dhje0ng(at)naver.

item.title: Awarded a bounty of $500 for BMW Automotive
item.description: Summary In recent months, we previously conducted a vehicle vulnerability analysis for BMW Automotive. This vulnerability is a service crash vulnerability, which could result in a potential denial of service. [사진 1] BMW Automotive Awarded a bounty of 500$ [사진 2] BMW GROUP HALL OF FAME
